title: Refactor tools.py into modular structure
description:
tools.py is ~3400 lines and growing. Refactor into modules:

Proposed structure:
- tools/
  - __init__.py (exports all tools)
  - scene.py (get_scene_info, serialize_scene, new_scene, save_scene, load_scene)
  - nodes.py (create_node, delete_node, get_node_info, list_children, find_nodes)
  - wiring.py (connect_nodes, disconnect_node_input, reorder_inputs, set_node_flags)
  - parameters.py (set_parameter, get_parameter_schema)
  - geometry.py (get_geo_summary)
  - rendering.py (render_viewport, render_quad_view)
  - materials.py (create_material, assign_material, get_material_info)
  - errors.py (find_error_nodes)
  - layout.py (layout_children, set_node_position, set_node_color, create_network_box)
  - code.py (execute_code)
  - help.py (get_houdini_help)

This prepares codebase for hybrid architecture where some tools may have different implementations for stdio vs remote mode.

title: Request timeout still crashes MCP context - need to handle timeout at MCP/FastMCP layer, not just in tool functions
description:
The CONNECTION_ERRORS handling added to tool functions doesn't prevent the crash because the timeout happens at the RPyC/network layer before our exception handler runs. The MCP server itself loses the connection and the tools disappear from OpenCode.

Need to investigate:
1. FastMCP async timeout handling
2. RPyC sync_request_timeout behavior  
3. Whether we need a wrapper/middleware at the server level
4. Possibly add keepalive or connection validation before heavy operations

Reproduction: Call render_viewport or get_geo_summary on a complex scene - the 60s timeout fires and crashes the MCP context.
notes: Fixed by optimizing get_geo_summary to run analysis on Houdini side via execute_code(). The old approach iterated over 22,500+ points via RPC calls, causing timeout. The new approach runs all geometry analysis locally in Houdini and returns a compact JSON result. Test confirmed: 22,500 point terrain now returns in milliseconds instead of timing out. Commit: 6900e34

title: Intelligence multipliers: Server-side AI summarization
description:
Premium feature: Use small models server-side to compress large responses.

Examples:
- get_geo_summary with 1M points → AI extracts key insights → returns 500 tokens instead of 50K
- find_error_nodes → AI triages and prioritizes → actionable summary
- Scene analysis → AI identifies optimization opportunities

Value prop: Client AI sees compressed, high-signal responses without massive token costs.

Requires: Remote mode (houdini-mcp-d2j) to be implemented first.
